page.title: 08Chapel-en-le-Frith By-pass
page.content: The by-pass has been thought about for seven years. There have been campaigns against it, but in August 1984 the men of Tarmac Construction Company and the Biwater Group set to work on the mammoth task in front of them. Its route is Chapel-en-le-Frith to Bridgemont and it should be completed by 1986, if everything goes well. A few months ago all you could see was fields. Now there's mud everywhere and machines digging through the rocks, then trucks collecting the earth and rocks and dumping them. At the end of next year it will be extremely busy and no-one will walk on it. The pasture in the field by our house was completely destroyed in the space of three hours.Now the view from our house is just rows of pillars and a huge mound of earth.{ { }by{M.Park, C.Francis, S.Heyworth
